title: A Spur to Immigrants
body:
To the Editor:

When the Mayor of Haverstraw, N.Y., is comfortable enough to say that one of the main problems with Dominican 
immigrants is that "They produce a lot of heavy garbage. I mean, rice and beans are heavy, you know" (news 
article, Sept. 30), let no one be mistaken that anti-immigrant sentiments, and more specifically anti-Latino 
sentiments, have been buoyed by the recent welfare and immigration laws. Such racist comments should provide 
further motivation to immigrants to naturalize, register and vote.

 

SANDRA MULLIN

Brooklyn, Sept. 30, 1996
